item.title: Report E-2023120279
item.description:
Report E-2023120279

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: FRANKFORT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 11, 2023, four (4) one-gallon containers of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel collected four (4) damaged 1-gallon containers of paint (UN1263) and containerized them in one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. All paint (UN1263) -impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums that were staged on-site in RLC's consolidated waste area.

item.title: Report E-2023120260
item.description:
Report E-2023120260

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: FRANKFORT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 8, 2023, three (3) one-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the skid and cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized absorbents to remediate the site. The crew then utilized hand tools to collect the spent absorbents. All spent absorbents, the damaged pails, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120255
item.description:
Report E-2023120255

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 8, 2023, one (!) one-gallon glass jar of perchloric acid was damaged in transit due to falling and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and containerized the spent absorbents in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the damaged jar in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • City: FRANKFORT

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 8, 2023, twenty (20) one-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and all boxes and containers were placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums. All drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120137
item.description:
Report E-2023120137

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XQC experienced a UN1760 Gunsmoke release from a box containing (2) 2.5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of material released from one of the jugs due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and pH Up neutralizer were utilized to clean and neutralize the release. The empty damaged drum, impacted absorbents, PPE, and impacted cardboard were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing 4 glass bottles(4L) of methanol. The box was left outside the hazmat cage, when picked up box was wet from one bottle that had the top broken off and caused spill inside. The other bottles inside are undamaged. Possible improper handling could be cause of damage. DescribePack: Box was stained from spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag, slanted inside a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2023120246
item.description:
Report X-2023120246

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T18:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X FIVE GALLON JERRICAN THAT WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THE JERRICAN IS MARKED WITH A COMMON NAME OF BOTTOM AND CHEMICAL NAME OF 116-030. EXXON MOBILE SAFETY DATA SHEET INSIDE THE BOX SHOWS THE PRODUCT IS STRIPPED TLP CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS GOODS IN TRANSPORTATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B81J28, RPD TECHNOLOGIES LLC, 3200 EUELL RD., CROSBY TX 77532-2905.

item.title: Report E-2023120211
item.description:
Report E-2023120211

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of "3.5 VOC LIGHT GRAY EPOXY ESTER PRIME" labeled as a UN1263, Paint, 3, PG II, shipping in 5gal metal pails. About 1 gallon spilled from 1 pail onto the trailer floor after the pallet gave out and the pail fell through, causing a puncture. Per the SDS, that the material was to be handled with skin/eye/hand PPE and due to the highly flammable properties would need to be kept away from all ignition sources. The total wasted product, damaged container, and impacted absorbents were contained in a 20gal metal drum and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one poly 330 gallon tote of prekote 30-266 (UN1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one gallon of product had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023120129
item.description:
Report E-2023120129

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: MELROSE PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 30, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel removed one (1) damaged and leaking 5-gallon pail from the load, and they wiped down any impacted pails with absorbent pads. The remediated pails were restacked and rewrapped for further shipment and processing. All spent absorbent pads and the one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was labeled as hazardous and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2023120118
item.description:
Report E-2023120118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 1oz spill of "Lacquer Thinner" from a 5gal metal pail was crushed by freight on the trailer loaded at the XCW terminal that impacted the trailer floor. The product is shipped as a "UN1263, Paint Related Material, HazClass 3, PGII". After reviewing the SDS with the terminal, it was determined that the staff could safely clean the spill using absorbents, proper skin/eye PPE, keeping the material away from ignition sources, and avoiding eating/drinking/smoking near the spill. The total waste content, being the wasted products, spent absorbents, and damaged container were packed into a 10gal metal waste container and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120245
item.description:
Report X-2023120245

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: COLLINSVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 11/10/2023, 13:58:31 Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5010097 at the station in Collinsville, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consists of two metal cans packed in a fiberboard box. Both cans appeared to have leaked at the seams, resulting in spillage. The spill was contained in the ULD asset. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found near door 150 on the other side of the load 1 belt. Package was outside of its box sitting inside a plastic bag. The box was upside down. Upon investigation it was determined that the plastic bag had a tear in it and had leaked out some of the contents. Item was a white powder and the box had Fully Regulated HazMat labeling. Package was immediately taken off the warehouse floor and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: The plastic bag did not have a seal on it of any kind. This kept the plastic bag inside open, which caused a leak. There was also a small hole on the bottom of the bag. This caused leakage from two separate areas. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.
